metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5148 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur in the compositor during certaingraphics operations when a raw pointer is used instead of a referencecounted one. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 52.7.3 and Firefox < 59.0.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
